title: Aligning Task- and Reconstruction-Oriented Communications for Edge Intelligence
author: Yufeng Diao (University of Glasgow), Yichi Zhang (University of Manchester), Changyang She (University of Sydney), Philip Guodong Zhao (University of Manchester), Emma Liying Li (University of Glasgow), ...
relevance_why: The framework proposed could influence communication system designs in speech and audio processing when considering real-time applications, potentially improving the way audio data is transmitted and processed for AI-driven tasks.
background: This work addresses the challenge of effectively communicating task-specific data for AI applications, particularly in edge intelligence scenarios where bandwidth and latency are critical.
contribution: The paper introduces an Aligned Task- and Reconstruction-Oriented Communication (ATROC) framework to address the inefficiencies of traditional communication systems in AI-driven applications, achieving a 99.19% reduction in communication load without compromising task performance.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Previous methods focused primarily on reconstruction-oriented communications that do not consider task relevance, leading to inefficient use of communication resources.
technical_comparison.novelty: This work integrates task-oriented communication with reconstruction-oriented frameworks, optimizing data transmission without sacrificing the underlying data structure.

key_innovation: The introduction of an information reshaper that adapts the communication process to the specific needs of AI tasks while preserving data integrity.
real_world_impact: This framework can greatly enhance the design of communication systems in autonomous driving and other real-time applications, where efficient and rapid data transfer is critical.
limitations: The framework may require substantial integration efforts with existing communication infrastructures to be effectively implemented.

new_terms.Aligned Task- and Reconstruction-Oriente: **ATROC** is a novel communication framework that combines task-specific information with reconstruction-oriented communication, aiming for efficient data transmission in AI applications.
new_terms.Information Bottleneck (IB): **Information Bottleneck** is a principle in information theory that seeks to find a balance between preserving relevant information for a task while compressing the input data.
